page.title: 07Landscape
page.content:
Once the area was covered in woodland, as you can guess from the names of the two villages,Bricket Wood and How Wood, and all of the streets and open spaces have plenty of trees, some of them very large.
The only industrial buildings, are those at Colney Street, on the industrial estate. The houses are surrounded by fields and woods;there are ups and downs,but no really big hills. Two rivers,the Ver and the Colne,meander through the area, and then join together. The landscape is being changed,at the moment,by the building of the last stretch of the M 25 motorway,to be built.
